pinyin: You2 tai4 fu4 guo2 zhu3 yi4
You2 tai4 fu4 guo2 zhu3 yi4 zhe3

sentences.english: Jewish holy sites were not maintained, and their cemeteries had been desecrated .
sentences.chinese: 因此猶太人的聖地不再得到維護，墓園被褻瀆。

sentences.english: "Menelaus" is that a good Jewish name?
Jewish people celebrate the holiday of Hanukkah.
All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron.
sentences.chinese: 所有猶太人開始指責摩西和亞倫。

sentences.english: Even so, Kaifeng Jews say they weren't singled out for discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，開封猶太人說他們並沒有遭到歧視對待。

sentences.english: The propitiatory system of the Jews is well known.
sentences.chinese: 猶太人的安撫體系是衆所周知的。

sentences.english: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 因有好些猶太人，爲拉撒路的緣故，回去信了耶穌。

sentences.english: The larger of the two 2 studies involved New Yorkers of Ashkenazim Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 大的那個研究包含了新紐約猶太德裔血系。

sentences.english: And some Jews would go along with this and some Jews would resist it.
sentences.chinese: 有些猶太人接受了，有些卻抵制。

sentences.english: Protestants and Jews have different ones.
sentences.chinese: 新教徒和猶太人則遵循另一部。

sentences.english: They cast a spell on you, you know, the Jews.
sentences.chinese: 他們在你身上投射了一道咒符，你知道嗎，猶太人。

sentences.english: The Weill family were very close-knit, as were many immigrant Jewish families of that era.
sentences.chinese: 一如當年許多猶太移民家族，魏爾家也是非常團結的。

sentences.english: There are plans for more building projects in many of the Jewish suburbs.
sentences.chinese: 而以政府在猶太郊區計劃開動更多的建設項目。

sentences.english: Even strangers who were not Jews, could run to them for safety.
sentences.chinese: 連非猶太人的寄居者，也可以跑到逃城尋求庇護。

sentences.english: Suspects accused of trying to carry out a bomb plot against New Yorks appeared in court.
sentences.chinese: 被指控密謀試圖炸燬紐約猶太教堂的疑犯出席聽證會。

definition: to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
